sections.title: Variety of Organisms
sections.description: Study of living organisms, their characteristics, classification, evolution and adaptations.

subtopics.title: Characteristics of Living Things
objectives: Differentiate between living and non-living things
Identify life processes in organisms

subtopics.title: Cell Structure and Functions
key_points: Functions of cell organelles: cell wall, cell membrane, nucleus, cytoplasm, mitochondria, lysosomes, chloroplasts, endoplasmic reticulum, ribosomes, centrosomes, Golgi bodies, chromosomes
objectives: Identify parts of plant and animal cells
Relate structure of organelles to their functions
Compare plant and animal cells

subtopics.title: Levels of Organization
objectives: Trace the hierarchy of organization in living organisms
Explain the significance of different levels including volume/surface area ratio

subtopics.title: Forms in which Living Cells Exist
key_points: Single and free-living: Amoeba, Paramecium, Euglena, Chlamydomonas
Part of a living organism: Cheek cells, onion root tip cells, epidermis of fleshy leaves
objectives: Describe the structure in relation to forms of existence
Illustrate dependence and interdependence
Distinguish groups of cells that form tissues from colonies or filaments

subtopics.title: Cell and its Environment
objectives: Explain the significance of these processes as factors affecting cell activities

topics.title: Classification of Living Things

subtopics.title: Kingdoms
key_points: Protoctista (Protista: Chlamydomonas, Amoeba; phyla: Rhizopoda, Zoomastigina, Apicomplexa, Ciliophora, Euglenophyta, Oomycota, Chlorophyta, Rhodophyta, Phaeophyta)
Fungi (moulds, mushrooms, Rhizopus; phyla: Zygomycota, Ascomycota, Basidiomycota)
Plantae (mosses, ferns, pines, oil palms, yam; divisions: Bryophyta (Hepaticae, Musci), Lycopodophyta, Filicinophyta, Coniferophyta, Cycadophyta, Angiospermophyta (Monocotyledoneae, Dicotyledoneae))
Animalia (corals, worms, insects, snails, fishes, frogs, snakes, monkeys, cows; external features: cockroach, butterfly, Tilapia, toad/frog, lizard, domestic fowl/pigeon)

objectives: Classify objects into living and non-living
Classify living things into kingdoms and major phyla/divisions
Illustrate differentiation and specialization in organisms

sections.title: Form and Functions
sections.description: Structure, function and physiology of different parts of organisms.

topics.title: Properties and Functions of the Living Cell

subtopics.title: Cellular Respiration
key_points: Aerobic respiration (glycolysis, Kreb's cycle, ATP role)
Anaerobic respiration (energy release, importance in food processing)

subtopics.title: Excretion
key_points: In single-celled aquatic organisms (diffusion by body surface, contractile vacuole)
Waste products of metabolism (carbon dioxide, water, ammonia)

subtopics.title: Growth
key_points: Aspects of growth (increase in dry weight, size, length, number of cells)
Regions of fastest growth in plants (root tip, shoot tip)
Influence of growth hormones and auxins
Development (enlargement, differentiation, primary and secondary growth)

objectives: Describe processes occurring within living cells
Explain the importance of anaerobic respiration in food processing

topics.title: Tissues and Supporting Systems

subtopics.title: Skeleton and Supporting Systems in Animals
key_points: Bones of the vertebral column, girdles, long bones of the appendicular skeleton
Functions of skeleton in animals (protection, support, locomotion, respiratory movement)

subtopics.title: Supporting Tissues in Plants
key_points: Main features of supporting tissues (turgid parenchyma, collenchyma, xylem, sclerenchyma)
T.S. of stem and root (epidermis, cortex, stele)

objectives: Explain how functions are performed
Describe the relationship of skeleton and muscles during movement

topics.title: Transport System

subtopics.title: Need for Transport
key_points: Substances have to move greater distances
Media (cytoplasm, cell sap, latex, body fluid)

subtopics.title: Transport in Animals
key_points: Structure of the heart, arteries, veins and capillaries
Composition and function of blood and lymph
Materials for transport (excretory products, gases, digested food, other nutrients)
General circulatory system, open systems in invertebrates

subtopics.title: Transport in Plants
key_points: Uptake and movement of water and mineral salts (eosin experiment)
Translocation (pressure flow hypothesis, cytoplasmic streaming, ringing experiment)
Movement of water to the apex (root pressure, transpiration, cohesion-tension, adhesion, water potential gradient)

objectives: Describe source of materials and forms transported

topics.title: Respiratory System

subtopics.title: Body Surface: Cutaneous, Gills and Lungs

objectives: Describe respiratory movements

topics.title: Excretory Systems and Mechanisms

subtopics.title: Regulation of Internal Environment (Homeostasis)
key_points: Kidney (structure, functions, conditions affecting, excretory products: urea, water, salts, uric acid)
Liver (functions, diseases: hepatitis, cancer, gall stones)

objectives: Explain the concept of excretion in plants

subtopics.title: Animal Hormones
key_points: Site of secretion, functions, effects of over and under-secretion (pituitary, thyroid, adrenal, pancreas, gonads)

subtopics.title: Plant Hormones
key_points: Auxins (effects on lateral bud development, leaf fall, adventitious roots, crop harvesting, growth, weed control)

topics.title: Nervous Coordination

subtopics.title: Central Nervous System
key_points: Parts of the brain and their functions (cerebrum, cerebellum, medulla oblongata, hypothalamus)
Structure and function of the spinal cord

subtopics.title: Peripheral Nervous System
key_points: Structure and functions of the neurone

objectives: Locate position of brain and spinal cord in dissected vertebrate
Identify regions of the brain

subtopics.title: Nose
key_points: Perception of smell (sensory cells, olfactory lobes)

subtopics.title: Tongue
key_points: Areas associated with tastes, taste buds, association with smell

topics.title: Reproduction

subtopics.title: Reproductive System of Mammals
key_points: Structure and function of male and female reproductive systems
Differences between male and female reproductive organs
Structure of the gametes (sperm and ovum)
Fertilization, development of the embryo and birth

subtopics.title: Metamorphosis in Insects
key_points: Life histories of butterfly, cockroach, housefly

subtopics.title: Comparison of Reproduction in Fish, Amphibian, Reptile, Bird and Mammal
key_points: Method of fertilization, number of eggs, parental care

subtopics.title: Reproduction in Flowering Plants
key_points: Arrangements of floral parts of a named insect-pollinated flower and a named wind-pollinated flower
Structure and function of the male and female parts of a flower
Pollination in Plants (types, features of cross-pollinated and self-pollinated flowers, agents of pollination, kinds of placentation)
Types of fruits (classification), structure of fruits

subtopics.title: Courtship Behaviour in Animals
key_points: Seasonal migration associated with breeding (herrings, eels, birds)

subtopics.title: Adaptive Features in a Developing Animal
key_points: Yolk in egg of fish, toad and birds for nourishment

subtopics.title: Germination of Seeds
key_points: Essential factors which affect developing embryo

objectives: Explain different methods of birth control
Relate features of flower to agents of pollination
Observe pollen grains germinated in sucrose solution

topics.title: Nutrition

subtopics.title: Plant Nutrition
key_points: Photosynthesis (process, equation, light/dark reactions, materials/conditions, evidence)

subtopics.title: Animal Nutrition
key_points: Modes of Nutrition (autotrophic, heterotrophic: holozoic, parasitic, symbiotic, saprophytic, chemosynthetic, carnivorous plants)
Alimentary System (tracts of different animals, description and function of parts)
Feeding habits (carnivorous, herbivorous, omnivorous, modifications and mechanisms)

subtopics.title: Nitrogen Cycle
key_points: Roles of bacteria, root nodules in leguminous plants

objectives: Relate the idea of balanced diet to diet
Explain malnutrition effects

sections.title: Ecology
sections.description: Study of organisms and their interactions with the environment.

topics.title: Ecosystem

subtopics.title: Components of the Ecosystem
key_points: Environment, biosphere, habitat, population, biotic community, ecosystem

subtopics.title: Simple Measurement of Ecological Factors
key_points: Humidity, temperature, wind speed, rainfall, light intensity

objectives: Explain importance of ecological factors to population

topics.title: Food Webs and Trophic Levels

subtopics.title: Food Chain and Food Web
key_points: Food/Energy relationship in aquatic and terrestrial environment

subtopics.title: Energy Flow
key_points: Solar radiation (intake and loss at earth's surface)

objectives: Classify organisms as producers, consumers, decomposers
Explain pyramid differences

subtopics.title: Pollution of the Atmosphere
key_points: Nature, names, sources and effects of air pollutants

subtopics.title: Ecological Succession
key_points: Structural changes in species composition, variety or diversity and increase in numbers
General characteristics and outcomes of succession
Succession in terrestrial and aquatic habitats
Secondary succession, climax of the succession: characteristic of a stable ecosystem

subtopics.title: Factors that Affect Population Size
key_points: Natality, mortality, emigration, immigration, food shortage, predation, competition and diseases

subtopics.title: Water Cycle
key_points: Importance of water to living organisms

subtopics.title: Microorganisms in Action
key_points: Beneficial effects in nature, medicine and industries
Harmful effects, diseases (cholera, measles, malaria, ring worm)

subtopics.title: Microorganisms Around Us
key_points: Groups of microorganisms (bacteria, viruses, algae, protozoa, fungi)

subtopics.title: Microorganisms in Our Bodies and Food

topics.title: Conservation of Natural Resources
key_points: Resources to be conserved (soil, water, wildlife, forest and minerals)

subtopics.title: Classification of Plants Based on Life Cycle
Effects of Agricultural Practices on Ecology
Aquatic Habitat
key_points: Distribution of plants and animals in the habitat
Adaptive features of plants and animals in the habitat

subtopics.title: Terrestrial Habitat
key_points: Marsh, forest, grass land, arid land
Distribution of plants and animals in habitat

topics.title: Balance in Nature
key_points: Dynamic equilibrium population and population density

sections.title: Heredity and Variation
sections.description: Study of variation, genetics and inheritance in organisms.

subtopics.title: Morphological Variations
key_points: Colour (skin, eye, hair coat of animals)

topics.title: Genetics
key_points: Transmission and expression of characteristics in organisms
Mendel's work in genetics (experiments, Mendelian traits, Mendelian laws)
Linkage, sex determination and sex linked characters

topics.title: Application of the Principles of Heredity

sections.title: Evolution
sections.description: Theories, evidence and processes of evolution.

sections.title: Country-Specific Topics
sections.description: Additional topics specific to certain countries.

subtopics.title: Introducing Biology
key_points: Biology as a science of life

subtopics.title: Cell Biology
key_points: Movement of substances into and out of cells (endocytosis, exocytosis)
DNA structure and replication, RNA transcription

subtopics.title: Diversity of Living Things
key_points: Characteristics of some of the orders of Class Insecta
Identification of organisms using biological keys

subtopics.title: Plant Structure and Physiology
key_points: Morphology of monocotyledonous and dicotyledonous plants

subtopics.title: Humans and their Environment
key_points: Health and hygiene (drug abuse, community health, first aid)

subtopics.title: Biology and Industry
key_points: Biology and water industry (contamination of water, identification of polluted water, waste water treatment)
Biology and fishing industry (fish stock management, fish farming)

topics.title: Section C - Nigeria, Sierra Leone, The Gambia and Liberia

subtopics.title: Concept of Living
key_points: Irritability as a basic characteristic of protoplasm (types of responses: taxis and nastism, environmental factors)

subtopics.title: Excretory Systems
key_points: Diseases of the kidney (nephritis, kidney stone, diuresis)
Diseases of the liver (infective hepatitis, cancer, gall stones)

subtopics.title: Reproduction
key_points: Metamorphosis and life history of housefly
Adaptive features in a developing animal (yolk, placenta)

subtopics.title: Plant and Animal Nutrition
key_points: Modes of nutrition (autotrophic, chemosynthetic, carnivorous plants)

subtopics.title: Basic Ecological Concepts
key_points: Population studies by sampling (population size, dominance, density)
Energy transformation in nature (energy loss, solar radiation)

subtopics.title: Nutrient Cycling in Nature (carbon cycle, water cycle)
Ecological Management (tolerance, minimum and maximum range)
Microorganisms: Man and His Health (microorganisms around us, in bodies and food, public health)
Application of Variations (crime detection, blood transfusion, determination of paternity)
Evolution (adaptation for survival, structural adaptation, adaptive colouration)
